此方様: (こなたさま) - (こなさま is an abbreviation used primarily by women) you
此様: (こなさま) - (こなさま is an abbreviation used primarily by women) you
此樣: (こなさま) - (こなさま is an abbreviation used primarily by women) you
此見よがし: (これみよがし) - for show; ostentatious; flaunting; showing off
此間: (こないだ) - the other day; lately; recently
武: (bu/mu) - military , military force, the sword; valor, bravery; military officer, military man
武を練る: (ぶをねる) - to train oneself in military arts
武人気質: (ぶじんかたぎ) - (yoji) martial spirit; military spirit; the spirit of true warriors
武侠小説: (ぶきょうしょうせつ) - swashbuckling stories; martial arts fiction; chivalric knight novels; wuxia xiaoshuo
武備: (ぶび) - military preparation; armaments; defenses; defences
武力: (ぶりょく) - armed might; military power; the sword; force
武力介入: (ぶりょくかいにゅう) - armed intervention
武力外交: (ぶりょくがいこう) - armed diplomacy
武力干渉: (ぶりょくかんしょう) - armed intervention
武力攻撃: (ぶりょくこうげき) - armed attack
武力行使: (ぶりょくこうし) - use of (military) force
武力行使容認決議: (ぶりょくこうしようにんけつぎ) - resolution authorizing the use of force
武力衝突: (ぶりょくしょうとつ) - military conflict; armed conflict
武勇: (ぶゆう) - bravery; military prowess; valour; valor
武勇伝: (ぶゆうでん) - martial story; heroic saga; tale of one's heroism; tale of heroic deeds; chivalric romance
武勇絶倫: (ぶゆうぜつりん) - (yoji) peerless bravery; matchless valor (in arms)
武器: (buki) - arma, armamento, munição; arma (algo usado para obter vantagem), recurso
武器取引: (ぶきとりひき) - arms business; arms dealing; weapons trade; weapons dealing
武器弾薬: (ぶきだんやく) - arms and ammunition; weapons and ammunition
武器輸出三原則: (ぶきゆしゅつさんげんそく) - Three Principles on arms exports
武器輸出禁止: (ぶきゆしゅつきんし) - arms embargo
武士の情け: (ぶしのなさけ) - samurai's compassion; samurai-like mercy
武士の鑑: (ぶしのかがみ) - paragon of knighthood
武士団: (ぶしだん) - band of warriors (often formed from related or dependent families); group of samurai
武士道: (ぶしどう) - Bushido; samurai code of chivalry
武士道の華: (ぶしどうのはな) - flower of chivalry (Bushido)
武家伝奏: (ぶけでんそう) - (yoji) Imperial official in charge of communication between the shogunate and the court (during the Muromachi and Edo periods)
武家奉公: (ぶけぼうこう) - (yoji) service with a samurai family; serving in a samurai household (as a valet, chambermaid, etc.)
武家時代: (ぶけじだい) - Feudal period (characterized by the rule of the shogunate as opposed to emperor, 1185-1867 CE)
武家衆: (ぶけしゅう) - samurai for the shogunate
武家諸法度: (ぶけしょはっと) - law decreeing rules for daimyo during Tokugawa shogunate
武張る: (ぶばる) - to be soldierly; to be martial
武徳殿: (ぶとくでん) - building on the greater palace grounds used by the emperor for viewing horse racing, horseback archery, etc.; martial arts practice hall at Heian Shrine (est. in 1895 by the Dai Nippon Butoku Kai, now defunct)
武教: (ぶきょう) - the teachings of Bushido
武漢三鎮: (ぶかんさんちん) - the Three Wuhan Cities
武者人形: (むしゃにんぎょう) - samurai doll
武者修業: (むしゃしゅぎょう) - samurai drill; knight errantry
武者修行: (むしゃしゅぎょう) - (yoji) traveling about to gain skill in combat (travelling)
武者振りつく: (むしゃぶりつく) - to grab at; to clutch; to grapple with
武者振り付く: (むしゃぶりつく) - to grab at; to clutch; to grapple with
武者振るい: (むしゃぶるい) - trembling with excitement
武者言葉: (ぶしゃことば) - samurai words & phrases
武者詞: (ぶしゃことば) - samurai words & phrases
武者震い: (むしゃぶるい) - trembling with excitement
